alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Dooly; Houston; Macon; Marion; Peach; Schley; Stewart; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 1:09PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Macon, southern Marion, northwestern Dooly, southeastern Chattahoochee, Stewart, Webster, southern Peach, southern Houston, Schley and northern Sumter Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 108 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Perry to near Ellaville to near Twin Springs, and moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Perry, Fort Valley, Lumpkin, Ellaville, Oglethorpe, Preston, Montezuma, Richland, Marshallville, Byromville, Ideal, Andersonville, Dooling, Putnam, Seminole, Hayneville, Houston Lake, New Era and La Crosse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Chattahoochee; Dooly; Houston; Macon; Marion; Peach; Schley; Stewart; Sumter; Webster
